page.title: 17OFFERTON INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: {Battersby's Hat Factory}first appeared in 1895 on Ordnance maps. In its heyday it employed more than 1000 people. With the serious decline of the Hatting Industry a number of firms, including Battersby's, amalgamated in 1966 to form the {Associated British Hat Manufacturers. The estate is now owned by Ashbank Ltd. They lease units to different firms. There are 27 companies in the estate. These companies make various goods, e.g. steel hand rails, radiators and window frames. Some buy ready made goods from factories to sell to shops, e.g. textile products, chain saws and sewing machines. Some are in the business of servicing industrial machinery. The firms have been in business from 12 months to 15 years.
